meanings.definition: To lift or gather something with a scooping motion.
meanings.sent1: She was scooping the sand into a bucket at the beach.
meanings.sent2: The chef was scooping out ice cream for the customers.
meanings.sent3: The cat was scooping its toys into a neat pile.
meanings.sent4: The excavator was scooping up dirt effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: He scooped up the fallen leaves with a quick scooping motion.

meanings.definition: The act of picking up or collecting something with a scooping motion.
meanings.sent1: The child used a small shovel for the sand scooping.
meanings.sent2: The zookeeper performed the animal feed scooping every morning.
meanings.sent3: The robot's job was the toy scooping in the playroom.
meanings.sent4: The competition involved a race for the most efficient scooping.
meanings.sent5: The ice cream shop had a special machine for fast scooping of flavors.
